m_szDocSumamry: New-Car Fuel Economy Still Important To Buyers January 28th, 2015 by Christopher DeMorro   Consumers tend to have short memories and fickle buying habits. Just a few years ago, when gas prices were peaking near $5.00 a gallon in some places, buyers flocked to fuel-efficient hybrids, and now they are going after plug-in cars. Now that gas prices have gone lower, SUV and truck sales have seen an uptick, but fuel economy still plays a big role in car-buying decisions. The Car Connection reports that a study by J.D. Power & Associates has found that new car buyers are still paying close attention
